name: GREGoR Data Model
description: Data model for the GREGoR consortium

columns.description: Subject/Participant Identifier (primary key)
columns.notes: anticipate using RC-assigned ID prefixed by gregor_center value

columns.description: An identifier used by GREGoR research centers to identify a set of participants for their internal tracking
GREGoR Center to which the participant is originally associated
Consent group pertaining to this participant's data
Is the originating GREGoR Center likely able to recontact this participant
Text description of any genetic testing for individual conducted prior to enrollment
Case specific PubMed ID if applicable
columns.notes: Publication which included participant;  Used for publications which include participant known prior to or after inclusion in GREGoR

columns.description: Identifier for family
participant_id for father; 0 if not available
columns.notes: intent is to be able to create .ped file format from consortium data;   Can enter 0 for mother or father not present

columns.description: participant_id for mother; 0 if not available
columns.notes: intent is to be able to create .ped file format from consortium data;   Can enter 0 for mother or father not present

columns.description: participant_id for twins, triplets, etc; 0 if not available
columns.notes: may be monozygotic, dizygotic, or polyzygotic

columns.description: Text description of individual relationship to proband in family, especially useful to capture relationships when connecting distant relatives and connecting relatives not studied
columns.notes: limit enumerated fields to values in seqr, and use the proband_relationship_detail for other options

columns.description: Other proband relationship not captured in enumeration above
examples: Father's brother's nephew's cousin's former roommate
columns.notes: keeping because not all relationships can be captured in proband_relationship (a way to describe 'other')

columns.description: Biological sex assigned at birth (aligned with All of Us). If individual has a known DSD / not expected sex chromosome karyotype, this can be noted in the phenotype information section.
Optional free-text field to describe known discrepancies between 'sex' value (female=>XX, male=>XY) and actual sex chromosome karyotype
examples: XY expected [for someone assigned female at birth with XY DSD]

columns.description: Self/submitter-reported race (OMB categories)
enumerations: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

columns.description: Self/submitter-reported ethnicity (OMB categories)
Additional specific ancestry description free text beyond what is captured by OMB race/ethnicity categories

Age at last observation, aka age in years at the last time the center can vouch for the accuracy phenotype data. For conditions with later age of onset, this field lets users know if individuals marked as unaffected were younger or older than the age when the phenotype is expected to appear.
Indicate affected status of individual (overall with respect to primary phenotype in the family). Note: Affected participants must have entry in phenotype table.
columns.notes:
useful from a ped file point of view;
general agreement to keep; phenotype table captures details and this is an overall status

columns.description: human-readable 'Phenotypic one-line summary' for why this individual is of interest. Could be the same as the term_details value in the Phenotype table. Strongly encourage/required for proband.
examples: Missing one variant in gene XXX
columns.notes: For unaffected/relatives, can note 'parent of ...' or 'relative of ...'

columns.description: age in years at which consent was originally obtained
Identifier for family (primary key)
columns.notes: Needs to be Unique across centers, use participant.gregor_center as ID prefix.

columns.description: Indicate if consanguinity is present or suspected within a family
Free text description of any additional consanguinity details
columns.examples: Parents are second cousins once removed

columns.description: name of file (renamed from pedigree_image because it can contain a PED file or image)
columns.notes: pedigree file should be deposited to upload workspace

columns.description: Free text description of other family structure/pedigree file caption or legend.
columns.examples: Additional informative family members not sequenced. Sequenced individuals indicated with sample_ID.
columns.notes: clarifying purpose: sometimes no PED file is available and the effort involved to encode a full pedigree is high when an image is already available (i.e. legacy publication describing the family)

columns.description: Details about family history that do not fit into structured fields. Family relationship terms should be relative to the proband.
columns.notes: useful if extended family history suggestive of mode of inheritance

columns.description: primary key
columns.notes: This ID generated when loading into AnVIL data table and is not included in the uploaded .tsv file

columns.description: Subject/Participant Identifier

columns.notes:
HPO (requirement that phenotype must be described in HPO)
MONDO (optional)
OMIM (opt)
ORPHANET (opt)
SNOMED (opt)
ICD10 (opt)

columns.description: modifier of a term where the additional details are not supported/available as a term in HPO
columns.examples: intellectual disability, no IQ test but 3rd grade reading level at 15 years old

columns.notes:
values are subterm of 'Onset' HP:0003674 - specifically,
HP:0003581 | Adult onset
HP:0030674 | Antenatal onset
HP:0011463 | Childhood onset
HP:0003577 | Congenital onset
HP:0025708 | Early young adult onset
HP:0011460 | Embryonal onset
HP:0011461 | Fetal onset
HP:0003593 | Infantile onset
HP:0025709 | Intermediate young adult onset
HP:0003621 | Juvenile onset
HP:0034199 | Late first trimester onset
HP:0003584 | Late onset
HP:0025710 | Late young adult onset
HP:0003596 | Middle age onset
HP:0003623 | Neonatal onset
HP:0410280 | Pediatric onset
HP:4000040 | Puerpural onset
HP:0034198 | Second trimester onset
HP:0034197 | Third trimester onset
HP:0011462 | Young adult onset

this field should use the same ontology as above (e.g. Mondo disease characteristic if using mondo). 
It should be a | delimited list of valid HPO IDs that are subordinate to HP:0012823 (clinical modifier) (For HPO terms) or a
| delimited list of valid MONDO IDs that are subordinate to MONDO_0021125 (disease characteristic) (For MONDO terms)

columns.description: identifier for an analyte from a primary biosample source (primary key)
columns.notes:
ID is at level of analyte
Stanford example: SubjectID-TubetypeCode-TissueCode

columns.description: analyte derived from the primary_biosample. The actual thing you're sticking into a machine to analyze/sequence
details about how the analyte or original biosample was extracted or processed
columns.notes: Regarding PMBC isolations from CPT tubes;  Isolations of PBMCs should be done on wet ice following the protocol.  Use only chilled cell freezing media.   Isolated PBMCs in freezing media

columns.description: Tissue type of biosample taken from the participant that the analyte was extracted or processed from (for unknown can use tissue - UBERON:0000479), e.g. skin, liver, brain
columns.notes:
Contact the GREGoR Data Standards WG to expand the list of allowable UBERON codes. Currently allowed values are:
UBERON:0000479 (tissue) 
UBERON:0003714 (neural tissue) 
UBERON:0001836 (saliva) 
UBERON:0001003 (skin epidermis) 
UBERON:0002385 (muscle tissue) 
UBERON:0000178 (whole blood) 
UBERON:0002371 (bone marrow) 
UBERON:0006956 (buccal mucosa)
UBERON:0001359 (cerebrospinal fluid)
UBERON:0001088 (urine)
UBERON:0019306 (nose epithelium)
CL: 0000034 (iPSC)
CL: 0000576 (monocytes - PBMCs)
CL: 0000542 (lymphocytes - LCLs)
CL: 0000057 (fibroblasts)
UBERON: 0005291 (embryonic tissue)
CL: 0011020 (iPSC NPC)
UBERON: 0002037 (cerebellum tissue)
UBERON: 0001133 (cardiac tissue)

columns.description: Optional ID for the biosample; allows for linking of multiple analytes extracted or processed from the same biosample
Free text to capture information not in structured fields
If applicable to disease (suspected mosaic), is the tissue from an affected source or an unaffected source?
age or participant in years at biosample collection
columns.notes: ages >89 are considered PHI.

columns.description: The list of drugs patient is on, at the time of sample collection. This information is helpful during analysis of metabolomics and immune asssays. Free Text
columns.notes: this is relevant when analyzing metabolomics data

columns.description: If the patient was fasting, when the sample was collected. this is relevant when analyzing metabolomics data. Free Text
his is relevant when analyzing metabolomics data
columns.notes: this is relevant when analyzing metabolomics data

columns.description: passage_number is relevant for fibroblast cultures and possibly iPSC.
time (in hours) from collection to freezing the sample. delayed freeze turns out to be useful / important info for PaxGene blood (for RNA isolation).
columns.notes: Regarding PaxGene blood processing for RNA:   Strict adherence following blood draw; ie minimum 2hrs at Room Temp, longer may be better including overnight incubations.   Post thaw samples to Room Temp and allow another 2 hrs incubate prior to processing.   All in accord with the PaxGene RNA blood isolation manual.

columns.description: details regarding sample transformation
columns.notes: If sample was transformed

columns.description: freetext (limited characters) to concisely describe if there are any QC issues that would be important to note
columns.examples: degraded sample; unable to obtain more DNA

columns.description: table_name.experiment_id_in_table
table_name.aligned_id_in_table
identifier for experiment_dna_short_read (primary key)
columns.notes: RCs make their own IDs, must begin with center abbreviation as defined in participant table; need to be globally unique in consortium; may be generated by prepending experiment_sample_id with center abbreviation

columns.description: identifier used in the data file (e.g. VCF header / LIMS ID)
columns.notes:
may be the same as experiment_short_read_id if the file does contain sample identifiers
should be present if downstream file contains a sample_id (e.g. BAM, VCF)
some centers have one id for the sample (tube) and a diff ID for the sample as named in the VCF; experiment_sample_id = ID in the VCF file; analyte_id = ID for the tube/aliquot/whatever

columns.description: Library prep kit used
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: sequenced read length (bp); GREGoR RCs do paired end sequencing, so is the example of 100bp indicates 2x100bp.
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; all RCs are doing paired-end reads.
facilitates having exome and GS-SR experiments in the same experiment_details table

columns.description: Which capture kit is used. Can be missing if RC receives external data
columns.examples: NimbleGen SeqCap EZ Human Exome Library v2.0

columns.description: name and path of bed file uploaded to workspace
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: Date of data generation (First sequencing date)
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; ISO 8601 date format

columns.description: insert size the protocol targets for DNA fragments
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: sequencing platform used for the experiment
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: identifier for aligned_short_read (primary key)
columns.notes: experiment_short_read_id + alignment indicator

columns.description: identifier for experiment
name and path of file with aligned reads
name and path of index file corresponding to aligned reads file
md5 checksum for file
Software including version number
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: For WGS, mean coverage is calculated as total aligned bases divided by length of the genome. For WES, mean coverage is calculated as total bases within capture regions divided by length of the capture regions. The capture regions are defined in the BED file for the sample (linked in the experiment_dna_short_read table targeted_region_bed_file field).
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: brief description of the analysis pipeline used for producing the file; perhaps a DOI or link to something like a WDL file or github repository
describe if there are any QC issues that would be important to note
identifier for a set of experiments (primary key)
columns.notes:
RCs make their own IDs (these must begin with center-specific prefix). 
aligned_dna_short_read_set_id links the aligned_dna_short_read table to the called_variants_dna_short_read table. For centers that are only uploading single sample files, the aligned_short_read_set_id and aligned_short_read_id values can be identical. For centers uploading multi-sample files, they will need to come up with a value for aligned_short_read_set_id that makes sense to them for indicating the sample group for a multi-sample callset, and use that same value in called_variants_short_read.
the identifier for a single-sample aligned_dna_short_read included in the read_set (one per row)

columns.description: unique key for table (anvil requirement)
identifier for experiment set
name and path of the file with variant calls
md5 checksum for file
columns.notes: md5sum computed prior to upload (used to verify file integrity)

columns.description: variant calling software used including version number
types of variants called
columns.notes:
can add more values as the need arises
if there are two VCFs for SNV and Indels, there would be two different lines in this table; if combined in one VCF, a |-delimited entry

columns.description: brief description of the analysis pipeline used for producing the file; perhaps a link to something like a WDL file or github repository
identifier for experiment_rna_short_read (primary key)
columns.notes: RCs make their own IDs, must begin with center abbreviation as defined in participant table; need to be globally unique in consortium; may be generated by prepending experiment_sample_id with center abbreviation

columns.description: identifier used in the data file (e.g. VCF header / LIMS ID)
columns.notes:
may be the same as experiment_short_read_id if the file does contain sample identifiers
should be present if downstream file contains a sample_id (e.g. BAM, VCF)
some centers have one id for the sample (tube) and a diff ID for the sample as named in the VCF; experiment_sample_id = ID in the VCF file; analyte_id = ID for the tube/aliquot/whatever

columns.description: Library prep kit used
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: type of library prep
sequenced read length (bp); GREGoR RCs do paired end sequencing, so is the example of 100bp indicates 2x100bp.
columns.notes: contact the DCC if not doing paired-end or you wish to share data with unknown read length.

columns.description: single or paired end
Date of data generation (First sequencing date)
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; ISO 8601 date format

columns.description: sequencing platform used for the experiment
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: batch number for the site, important for future batch correction
RIN number for quality of sample
total number of reads
identifier for aligned_short_read (primary key)
columns.notes: experiment_short_read_id + alignment indicator

columns.description: identifier for experiment
name and path of file with aligned reads
name and path of index file corresponding to aligned reads file
md5 checksum for file
annotation file used for alignment
Software including version number
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: path of (log) file with all parameters for alignment software
If any post processing was applied
Mean coverage of either the genome or the targeted regions
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: how many reads aligned to just one place
how many reads aligned to multiple places
how many reads didn't align
describe if there are any QC issues that would be important to note
identifier for experiment_nanopore (primary key)
columns.notes: RCs make their own IDs, must begin with center abbreviation as defined in participant table; need to be globally unique in consortium; may be generated by prepending experiment_sample_id with center abbreviation

columns.description: identifier used in the data file (e.g. VCF header / LIMS ID)
columns.notes:
may be the same as experiment_short_read_id if the file does contain sample identifiers
should be present if downstream file contains a sample_id (e.g. BAM, VCF)
some centers have one id for the sample (tube) and a diff ID for the sample as named in the VCF; experiment_sample_id = ID in the VCF file; analyte_id = ID for the tube/aliquot/whatever

columns.description: Library prep kit used
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: method used for shearing/fragmentation
columns.examples: NA, Covaris g-tube (DNA volume/concentration, RCF's, etc.)

columns.notes: While the most common use of ONT is whole-genome sequencing, targeted sequencing is possible and may be of interest to the consortium.

columns.description: Capture method used.
name and path of bed file uploaded to workspace
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: Date of data generation (First sequencing date)
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; ISO 8601 date format

columns.description: sequencing platform used for the experiment
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: chemistry type used for the experiment
columns.notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

columns.description: indicates whether samples were barcoded on this flowcell
name of the kit used for barcoding
identifier for aligned_nanopore (primary key)
columns.notes: experiment_short_read_id + alignment indicator

columns.description: identifier for experiment
name and path of file with aligned reads
name and path of index file corresponding to aligned reads file
md5 checksum for file
Software including version number
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: brief description of the analysis pipeline used for producing the file; perhaps a DOI or link to something like a WDL file or github repository
Mean coverage of either the genome or the targeted regions
columns.notes: Can be unknown if RC receives external data

columns.description: e.g. >=90% at 10x or 20x; per consortium decision
Contamination level estimate., e.g. <1% (display raw fraction not percent)
Comparison between reported sex vs genotype sex; Other if ploidy NOT XX or XY and Other if sex at birth is not known, thus unable to perform sex concordance
Total reads (before/ignoring alignment)
Number of bases (before/ignoring alignment)
Mean length of all reads (before/ignoring alignment)
Total aligned reads
Number of bases in aligned reads
Mean length of aligned reads
Mean empirical per-base error rate of aligned reads
Number between 1 and 100, na
Indicates whether 5mC and 6mA methylation has been called and annotated in the BAM file's MM and ML tags
identifier for a set of experiments (primary key)
columns.notes:
RCs make their own IDs (these must begin with center-specific prefix). 
aligned_dna_<type>_set_id links the aligned_dna_<type> table to the called_variants_dna_<type> table. For centers that are only uploading single sample files, the aligned_<type>_set_id and aligned_<type>_id values can be identical. For centers uploading multi-sample files, they will need to come up with a value for aligned_<type>_set_id that makes sense to them for indicating the sample group for a multi-sample callset, and use that same value in called_variants_<type>.
the identifier for a single-sample aligned_dna_<type> included in the read_set (one per row)

types of variants called
columns.notes:
can add more values as the need arises
if there are two VCFs for SNV and Indels, there would be two different lines in this table; if combined in one VCF, a |-delimited entry
